page.title: 01Introducing the Peak Park
page.content: On leaving the Sheffield boundary from the Owler Bar, Totley road or from the Eccleshall road across Dore moor, one is immediately aware of having entered the beautiful Peak National Park by the well known identification of a large millstone at the side of the road. The breathtaking hills and valleys are interspersed with woodland, wild moors and mysterious edifices. The area can be reached on foot by the more hardy visitors, by car,bus,coach,bicycle or train. First stop for many is the Fox House Inn, beyond Parson House Farm. This Inn has become part of the local language. It is a meeting place for ramblers, a focal point for hikers, and a shelter providing food, drink, and warmth throughout the year.
